2027 Despite many things being much better we’ll still have many of the same problems we do today, and we’ll be feeling like the world is falling apart and on the verge of collapse. While we’ve made huge strides in the last 40 years (the rivers of the northeast don’t catch on fire, the ozone holes are closing, acid rain is much less of a problem) we still have miles to go and promises to keep. We’ll see 3D printing go from a makers toy (for most people) to something useful in the home. We’ll see printed electronics in many places (I suspect low powered printed electronics will be usable with “snap together” power/USB/HDMI connectors. The Internet of things will go from promise to reality (it will be banal by then) Biotechnology produced everyday products will be available and less expensive than other products. Maybe we’ll have 3D printed bio material/organs at the next level of complexity (cartilage, kidneys, liver). The biggest change is probably that not owning a car has become a viable option for most adult Americans.
